  • Method Details

    • weather

      public static String weather(int month, int day)
      Write a static method named weather that takes two integers as parameters representing a month and day. The month is specified as an integer between 1 and 12, such as 1 for January, 2 for February, etc. The day of the month is an integer between 1 and 31. The method returns a String indicating the standard Toronto weather season for the given month and day. If the date falls between November 12 and March 15, the method should return "Winter" If the date falls between March 16 and June 15, the method should return "Spring" If the date falls between June 16 and August 25, the method should return "Summer" if the date falls between August 26 and November 1, the method should return "Fall" Otherwise, return "Unknown".

      Use of arrays or any Java library class (e.g., array, ArrayList ) is strictly forbidden. Violation of this will result in a 70% penalty on your marks. Try to solve this problem using Java Control Structures (selection structures, repetition structures, and nested Loops) only

      Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.

      Examples: 

       if month=1 and  day= 1 then return "Winter"
 if month=11 and  day= 1 then return "Fall"
 if month=11 and  day= 2 then return "Unknown"
 if month=5 and  day= 2 then return "Spring"

      Remember that double quotations are shown above to indicate the beginning and end of the string value, and these double quotations are not part of the return value.

      Parameters:
      month - Positive integer between 1 and 12, such as 1 for January, 2 for February, etc.
      day - Positive integer between 1 and 31
      Returns:
      String indicates the standard Toronto weather season for that month and day.

      Precondition: month and day are non-negative values

    • range

      public static String range(int limit1, int limit2)
      Write a static method name range that prints the sequence of numbers between a limit1 integer and limit2 integer. Also, the method computes the sum of all even and odd integers between the limit1 and limit2 input values. The method prints an increasing sequence if the limit1 is smaller than the limit2; otherwise, print a decreasing sequence. If the two limits are the same, that number should be printed by itself.

      Use of arrays or any Java library class (e.g., array, ArrayList ) is strictly forbidden. Violation of this will result in a 70% penalty on your marks. Try to solve this problem using Java Control Structures (selection structures, repetition structures, and nested Loops) only

      Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.

      Examples: 

       if limit1 = 1 , limit2 = 1 then return "Range (1)"
 if limit1 = 1 , limit2 = 9 then return "Range (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9): sum of odds (25) and sum of evens (20)"
 if limit1 = 9 , limit2 = 1 then return "Range (9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, 1): sum of odds (25) and sum of evens (20)"

      Remember that double quotations are shown above to indicate the beginning and end of the string value, and these double quotations are not part of the return value.

      Parameters:
      limit1 - limit1 integer value
      limit2 - limit1 integer value
      Returns:
      String value as shown in the examples above

      Precondition: limit1 and limit2 are non-negative values

    • temperature

      public static String temperature(double fahrenheit)
      Write a static method name temperature that converts a Fahrenheit degree to Celsius using the formula celsius = (5/9) (fahrenheit - 32). The method receives temperature degrees in Fahrenheit and returns string value as shown below in the examples. The celsius degree is rounded to two decimal points.

      Examples: 

       if fahrenheit=100.0 then return "Fahrenheit (100.0) is equivalent to (37.78) in Celsius"
 if fahrenheit=10.0 then return "Fahrenheit (10.0) is equivalent to (-12.22) in Celsius"
 if fahrenheit=49.0 then return "Fahrenheit (49.0) is equivalent to (9.44) in Celsius"

      Remember that double quotations are shown above to indicate the beginning and end of the string value, and these double quotations are not part of the return value.

      Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.
      Parameters:
      fahrenheit - input temperature value as double
      Returns:
      string value, see above examples

    • ageinyears

      public static String ageinyears(int days)
      Write a static method name ageinyears that takes the age in days and then calculates the age in years and remaining days. Assume there are 365 days in a year. The method return string value as shown in the examples below

      Examples: 

       if days=7000  then return "Age in days (7000), age in years is (19) with remaining days (65)"
 if days=1900 then return "Age in days (1900), age in years is (5) with remaining days (75)"
 if days=8016 then return "Age in days (8016), age in years is (21) with remaining days (351)"

      Remember that double quotations are shown above to indicate the beginning and end of the string value, and these double quotations are not part of the return value.

      Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.
      Parameters:
      days - input days value as int value
      Returns:
      String value as shown in the examples above
